section.name: Templates
section.p: The Depot build system will assign a template file to a project as the primary definition of the build strategy. The default standard template includes a series of common targets covering initialization, preparation, build, packaging, testing and installation.

subsection.name: Template Selection
subsection.p: A project template is selected in accordance with the following rules.

ol.li: If a file named build.xml exists in the project base directory then that file will be used as the build template.
Otherwise, if the property project.template is defined then use the uri declared under this property.
Otherwise, if the property project.standard.template is defined then use the uri declared under this property.
Otherwise, the default standard template is selected.

tr.td: Defines a set of standard targets which are used primarily to fire build events which in turn are handled by project listeners.
Project initialization including the establishment of the project context.
Copies the content of the ${basedir}/src directory to ${basedir}/target/build filtering content in the process. See prepare task for additional information.
Trigger the build phases event - typically triggering code compilation.
Validates that the build has produced the artifacts declared under the project defintion and copies these to the local cache.

subsection.name: Technical Note
subsection.p: Currently the standard template includes a checkstyle tasks. This should be considered as temporary pending development of the builder configuration to support site wide common targets.
